TopicTitle: A quirky and cool discovery you made today

Articles.Content:
This is for small things you noticed that either:

 

A: Surprised you.

B: You think others would benefit from knowing.

 

(this is not a place for bug reporting)

 

I noticed that the altimeter reads your distance from the surface of Kerbin even when flying over water!  I learned this the hard way by hitting the water while looking at an altimeter that still read a few hundred meters above the surface.  I thought those waves looked rather close!
Going EVA while in zero-g, the Kerbal's boots stick to the vessel skin like a sci-fi TV show in the 60's. Valentina was able to walk all over the skin of the Kerbal X-2 in orbit around the Mun.

The KSC is really detailed. There are meter-things at the entrance to the garage, and ramps to the higher levels of parking (not yet collideable). Also, there are some road signs on the roads around the KSC, like stop signs and the such. There are also two pools outside the R&D building, which you can swim in, that have ladders to climb out, and little lifeguard chairs. In the pools, are parts such as the Mk-3 command pod evidently being tested in some way.
